‘You spoke of outrage just now, Avdotya Romanovna,’ he said, smiling.  
‘Sofya Semyonovna is not home. You’re alone with me.’  
‘Scoundrel!’ whispered Dounia.  
‘You could not complain. No one would believe you.’  
‘You think I would betray my brother?’  
‘Your brother’s fate is in your hands. I will be your slave.’  
Dounia pulled out a revolver, cocked it, and laid it on the table.  
Svidrigaïlov jumped up, surprised but smiling.  
‘Aha! So that’s it, is it?’ he exclaimed.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia confronts Svidrigaïlov about his threats, revealing her own readiness to defend herself with a revolver.
